ground_truth: Saruman stands over the Palantir, his hands cupping the massive eye, then is seated as his Orc Overseer approaches while Gandalf lies unconscious on a cold obsidian floor. Gandalf stands as the camera pulls back to reveal him stranded on the summit of Orthanc, marooned on the tiny, flat peak, surrounded on all sides by a sheer 500-foot drop. Another whispering wail rends the air as Gandalf crosses quickly to the edge and peers down: POV: One of the beautiful Isengard trees is being ripped from the ground by the Orcs, and Gandalf looks on in horror as Orcs hack into the trunk with axes. Saruman stands in the rain looking out into the dark night as the Orc overseer sidles up to him, axe in hand, sweating with exertion, and more and more trees are hauled down and killed as Gandalf looks on in helpless despair. Meanwhile, the rugged countryside shows the hobbits journeying on, led by Strider, who stops before a distant hill topped by an ancient ruin. Frodo, Merry, and Pippin collapse into a small hollow halfway up Weathertop, muddy and exhausted, as Strider drops four small swords at the hobbits' feet. Frodo's eyes flicker open, and he suddenly sits up, sniffing the air while Sam, Merry, and Pippin huddle over a small fire with sausages and bacon sizzling in a hot frying pan. Five Ringwraiths on foot are running up the steep slope unnaturally fast, prompting Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin to clamber desperately towards the summit, clutching their swords. They race into a ring of broken stones on the summit of Weathertop, the ruined base of an ancient tower, and stand back-to-back in the centre of the ring, waiting for the first assault. One by one, the five Ringwraiths appear, brandishing gleaming swords, moving slowly towards the hobbits, with their leader, the Witch King, in the center. Sam rushes forward with a cry and swings his sword at the Witch King, who blocks the blow with his own sword, causing Sam's blade to shatter as the Witch King lashes out with his fist, sending Sam flying. Merry and Pippin, overcome with terror, throw themselves flat on the ground. In slow motion, Frodo's hand goes into his pocket and pulls out the ring as the Ringwraiths close in on Frodo, with a venomous whisper dancing in his head. The five Ringwraiths utter a chilling screech of excitement as Frodo is unable to resist any longer, falls to his knees, and slips on the ring, disappearing. Frodo finds himself in the weird twilight world, where he looks upon the Ringwraiths, now visible in their true appearance as five ghouls dressed in long grey robes with white hair and pallid, ruthless faces, as the Witch King extends a haggard hand towards Frodo, reaching for the ring on his finger.

test_cases.description:
Saruman, the powerful wizard, stands ominously over the Palantir, his hands carefully cupping the massive, all-seeing eye. He then takes a seat as his Orc Overseer approaches him, while nearby, Gandalf lies unconscious on the cold, hard surface of the obsidian floor. As the scene unfolds, Gandalf gradually rises to his feet, and the camera dramatically pulls back to reveal his precarious situation. He is stranded on the summit of Orthanc, marooned on the tiny, flat peak, surrounded on all sides by a sheer, dizzying 500-foot drop. Another whispering wail pierces the air, and Gandalf quickly crosses to the edge, peering down with a sense of urgency. From his point of view, one of the beautiful, ancient Isengard trees is being violently ripped from the ground by the Orcs. Gandalf watches in horror as the Orcs mercilessly hack into the tree trunk with their axes. Meanwhile, Saruman stands in the pouring rain, gazing out into the dark, foreboding night. The Orc overseer sidles up to him, axe in hand, sweating profusely from exertion, as more and more trees are ruthlessly hauled down and destroyed. Gandalf looks on in helpless despair, unable to intervene.

In the meantime, the rugged countryside reveals the hobbits on their journey, led by the mysterious Strider. He stops before a distant hill, which is topped by an ancient ruin. Frodo, Merry, and Pippin, muddy and exhausted, collapse into a small hollow halfway up Weathertop. Strider drops four small swords at the hobbits' feet, preparing them for what lies ahead. Frodo's eyes flicker open, and he suddenly sits up, sniffing the air with a sense of alertness. Nearby, Sam, Merry, and Pippin huddle over a small fire, with sausages and bacon sizzling enticingly in a hot frying pan. Suddenly, five Ringwraiths on foot are seen running up the steep slope with unnatural speed, prompting Frodo, Sam, Merry, and Pippin to clamber desperately towards the summit, clutching their swords tightly. They race into a ring of broken stones on the summit of Weathertop, the ruined base of an ancient tower, and stand back-to-back in the center of the ring, bracing themselves for the first assault. One by one, the five Ringwraiths appear, brandishing their gleaming swords, moving slowly and menacingly towards the hobbits, with their leader, the Witch King, positioned in the center. Sam, filled with courage, rushes forward with a cry and swings his sword at the Witch King. However, the Witch King skillfully blocks the blow with his own sword, causing Sam's blade to shatter into pieces. The Witch King then lashes out with his fist, sending Sam flying through the air. In slow motion, Frodo's hand reaches into his pocket and pulls out the ring as the Ringwraiths close in on him, with a venomous whisper echoing in his head. The five Ringwraiths utter a chilling screech of excitement as Frodo, unable to resist any longer, falls to his knees and slips on the ring, disappearing from sight. The Witch King extends a haggard hand towards Frodo, reaching ominously for the ring on his finger.

Gandalf stands as the camera pulls back to reveal him stranded on the summit of Orthanc marooned on the tiny flat peak surrounded on all sides by a sheer 500foot drop. Another whispering wail rends the air as Gandalf crosses quickly to the edge and peers down. POV. One of the beautiful Isengard trees is being ripped from the ground by the Orcs and Gandalf looks on in horror as Orcs hack into the trunk with axes. Saruman stands in the rain looking out into the dark night as the Orc overseer sidles up to him axe in hand sweating with exertion. and more and more trees are hauled down and killed as Gandalf looks on in helpless despair. Meanwhile the rugged countryside shows the hobbits journeying on led by Strider who stops before a distant hill topped by an ancient ruin. Frodo Merry and Pippin collapse into a small hollow halfway up Weathertop muddy and exhausted as Strider drops four small swords at the hobbits' feet. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. Frodo's eyes flicker open and he suddenly sits up sniffing the air. while Sam Merry and Pippin huddle over a small fire with sausages and bacon sizzling in a hot frying pan. Five Ringwraiths on foot are running up the steep slope unnaturally fast prompting Frodo Sam Merry and Pippin to clamber desperately towards the summit clutching their swords. They race into a ring of broken stones on the summit of Weathertop the ruined base of an ancient tower and stand backtoback in the centre of the ring waiting for the first assault. One by one the five Ringwraiths appear brandishing gleaming swords moving slowly towards the hobbits with their leader the Witch King in the center. Sam rushes forward with a cry and swings his sword at the Witch King who blocks the blow with his own sword causing Sam's blade to shatter as the Witch King lashes out with his fist sending Sam flying. Merry and Pippin overcome with terror throw themselves flat on the ground. In slow motion Frodo's hand goes into his pocket and pulls out the ring as the Ringwraiths close in on Frodo with a venomous whisper dancing in his head. The five Ringwraiths utter a chilling screech of excitement as Frodo is unable to resist any longer falls to his knees and slips on the ring disappearing. Frodo finds himself in the weird twilight world where he looks upon the Ringwraiths now visible in their true appearance as five ghouls dressed in long grey robes with white hair and pallid ruthless faces as the Witch King extends a haggard hand towards Frodo reaching for the ring on his finger.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Glinda hovers over the Cauldron, her feet pressing against the giant orb, then relaxes as her Rabbit Assistant departs while Merlin snoozes on a warm marble bench. Merlin leaps as the spotlight zooms out to show him hovering above the crest of Mordor, swaying on the narrow, steep bluff, encircled by an endless 20-foot ascent. Another giggling cheer breaks the silence as Merlin strolls slowly to the center and gazes upward: POV: One of the ancient Rohan cottages is being lifted from the sky by the Dwarves, and Merlin gazes on in delight as Dwarves carve into the walls with chisels. Glinda sits in the sunlight pondering into the bright dawn as the Rabbit assistant skips away from her, paintbrush in hand, beaming with joy, and fewer and fewer cottages are erected and decayed as Merlin gazes on in joyous excitement. Meanwhile, the sparse wilderness displays the ogres meandering along, led by Bard, who dances before a nearby valley enclosed by a modern fortress. Bilbo, Fred, and George climb into a large pit halfway down Rivendell, energetic and inspired, as Bard lifts two large shields at the ogres' knees. Bilbo's arms spring shut, and he quickly rises, detecting the breeze while Ted, Fred, and George leap over a massive bonfire with steaks and vegetables melting in a cold saucepan. Twelve Faeries on bicycles are flying down the gentle slope awkwardly slow, prompting Bilbo, Ted, Fred, and George to swim carefully towards the bottom, juggling their shields. They glide into a cave of ancient mountainside at the bottom of Rivendell, the pristine peak of a modern castle, and kneel shoulder-to-shoulder in the center of the cave, waiting for the final skirmish. One by one, the twelve Faeries descend, discarding glowing shields, gliding rapidly away from the ogres, with their captain, the Elf Queen, at the side. Ted dashes backward with a laugh and drops his shield at the Elf Queen, who dodges the throw with her own shield, causing Ted's weapon to dissolve as the Elf Queen embraces with her foot, sending Ted soaring. Fred and George, consumed with joy, propel themselves upright into the sky. In fast motion, Bilbo's foot dives into his jacket and pushes out the necklace as the Faeries soar up from Bilbo, with a harmonious melody humming in his mind. The twelve Faeries emit an inspiring anthem of delight as Bilbo can resist no more, rises on his feet, and tosses on the necklace, appearing. Bilbo sees himself in the bright daylight realm, where he gazes upon the Faeries, now hidden in their false forms as twelve sprites adorned in short green cloaks with black wings and vibrant, kind faces, as the Elf Queen retracts a glowing toe from Bilbo, gesturing for the necklace on his wrist.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Saruman stands over the Palantir as his Orc Overseer approaches, while Gandalf lies unconscious on the peak of Orthanc, trapped with a sheer drop surrounding him. He watches helplessly as Orcs destroy the beautiful Isengard trees. Meanwhile, Frodo, Merry, Pippin, and Sam, led by Strider, journey through rugged terrain to Weathertop, where they rest with a small fire. Frodo senses danger, and soon, five Ringwraiths, led by the Witch King, chase the hobbits to the summit. The hobbits prepare for battle in a ring of ruins. Sam attacks the Witch King but is easily overpowered. As Merry and Pippin cower, Frodo is overwhelmed by the Ringwraiths’ presence. Succumbing to the ring's call, he puts it on and vanishes into a twilight world, seeing the Ringwraiths’ true, ghastly forms as the Witch King reaches for him.
